alert.note: Alert for Lower Treasure Valley; Owyhee Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 7:10PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Payette, western Canyon, northwestern Owyhee and northeastern Malheur Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 709 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Westfall to near Owyhee Reservoir to near Iron Point. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Pelican Point and Twin Springs Campground around 710 PM MDT. Board Corral Mountain, Sugarloaf Butte, Little Valley and Owyhee Reservoir around 720 PM MDT. Bully Creek Reservoir, Mahogany Mountain, Leslie Gulch and Slocum Creek Campground around 730 PM MDT. Parma, Homedale, Vale and Marsing around 740 PM MDT. Ontario, Caldwell, Greenleaf and Notus around 750 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
